option.value: {"/Users/annapomytkina/AndroidStudioProjects/Text2Cash":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/HomeScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a single Composable function `HomeScreen` that represents the home screen of a text-to-cash application.\\n\\n`HomeScreen`: This function creates the UI for the home screen, which includes a title, two dropdown menus, and a \\\"Scan\\\" button that navigates to the camera screen.\",\"/data/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android library project. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android SDK version, minimum SDK version, and dependencies. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it configures the build process for the Android library project.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/text2cash/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. It does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: This is a unit test class that tests the basic functionality of the application.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: This test function checks that the addition operation is working correctly by asserting that 2 + 2 equals 4.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a basic example of a unit test for an Android application, which can be used as a starting point for writing more comprehensive tests.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is an Android Gradle build script that configures the build settings and dependencies for a Kotlin-based Android application using Compose UI and Dagger Hilt for dependency injection.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions, but instead defines the following:\\n\\n`plugins`: Applies the necessary Android, Kotlin, and Dagger Hilt plugins for the project.\\n\\n`android`: Configures the Android build settings, including the namespace, compile SDK version, default app settings, and Kotlin compiler options. It also enables Compose UI and specifies resource packaging settings.\\n\\n`dependencies`: Declares the dependencies for the project, including Android core libraries, Compose UI components, Dagger Hilt, and testing frameworks.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/ui/theme/Theme.kt\":\"This file defines the theme for the \\\"Text2Cash\\\" Android app using Jetpack Compose. It includes the following:\\n\\n`DarkColorScheme`: A private color scheme for the dark theme.\\n\\n`LightColorScheme`: A private color scheme for the light theme.\\n\\n`Text2CashTheme`: A composable function that sets the theme for the app based on the system\\u0027s dark mode setting and the device\\u0027s Android version.\\n\\nThe file sets up the color schemes and typography for the app\\u0027s UI, allowing it to adapt to the user\\u0027s system theme preferences and support dynamic color on Android 12 and later devices.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/MyApp.kt\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`MyApp`: This class extends the `Application` class and is annotated with `@HiltAndroidApp`, which is a Dagger Hilt annotation that enables dependency injection for the application.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to define a custom `Application` class for the Android app, which is necessary for setting up Dagger Hilt and enabling dependency injection throughout the application.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but instead, it sets up the necessary plugins for the project, including the Android application plugin, Kotlin Android plugin, Kotlin Compose plugin, and the Android library plugin.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/ui/theme/Color.kt\":\"This file defines the color palette for the \\\"Text2Cash\\\" app\\u0027s user interface theme. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a set of color values that can be used throughout the app\\u0027s UI.\\n\\n`Purple80`: A dark purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey80`: A dark purple-grey color.\\n`Pink80`: A dark pink color.\\n\\n`Purple40`: A lighter purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey40`: A lighter purple-grey color.\\n`Pink40`: A lighter pink color.\",\"/domain/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android library project. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android SDK version, source and target compatibility, and dependencies. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build settings for the Android library project.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/text2cash/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for the \\\"Text2Cash\\\" Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the application\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the application\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the application\\u0027s package name matches the expected value, which is \\\"com.example.text2cash\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file appears to be the main entry point for an Android application called \\\"Text2Cash\\\". It sets up the navigation and screens for the application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity class that sets up the application\\u0027s content and enables edge-to-edge mode.\\n\\n`TranslatorCurrencyApp`: A composable function that sets up the navigation for the application, including the \\\"home\\\" screen.\\n\\n`HomeScreen`: A composable function that likely represents the main screen of the application, though it is not implemented in this code snippet.\\n\\nThe file sets up the basic structure of the application, including the main activity and the navigation between screens. It does not contain any implementation details for the specific screens or functionality of the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/text2cash/ui/theme/Type.kt\":\"This file defines the typography styles for a Compose-based Android application. It sets the default text style for the `bodyLarge` component, and provides commented-out examples for other text styles such as `titleLarge` and `labelSmall`.\\n\\n`Typography`: Defines the set of Material typography styles to be used in the application.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file that sets up the project structure and dependency management for a multi-module Android project called \\\"Text2Cash\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the following:\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories for Gradle plugins, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories for project dependencies, including Google and Maven Central, and sets the repositories mode to fail on project-specific repositories.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"Text2Cash\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\", \\\":domain\\\", \\\":data\\\")`: Includes the sub-modules \\\"app\\\", \\\"domain\\\", and \\\"data\\\" in the project.\"}"}
